description: Surrogate primary key for the part status record; uniquely identifies each status value.
Business identifier or name of the part status used in lookups and references.
Free-text description explaining the meaning or usage of the part status.
Flag indicating whether this status is the default assigned to newly created parts.
Flag that hides this status from selection lists and search lookups within the application.
Flag that excludes this status from reports and visualizations.
Indicates the status code itself is disabled and should no longer be used in new transactions.
Optional notes or comments about this part status.
System timestamp of the most recent change to this status record.
When enabled, parts with this status may trigger automatic purchase or reorder actions.
Likely identifier of the user who last modified this record; sample suggests timestamp; confirm with SME.
Identifier of the user who created this status record.
Timestamp when this status record was created by a user.
Identifier of the user who most recently modified this status record.
Timestamp when a user last modified this status record.
